question: Tottenham vs. Fulham
description:
In the upcoming EPL game, scheduled for October 23, 3:00 PM ET: 

If Tottenham wins, this market will resolve to "TOT". If Fulham wins or the game is a draw, this market will resolve to "FUL / Draw". 

If the game is not completed by October 30, 2023 (11:59 PM ET), the market will resolve to 50-50

events.title: EPL
events.description: This is a market group for EPL games happening on 2023-10-23

question: Vikings vs. 49ers
description:
In the upcoming NFL game, scheduled for October 23, 8:15 PM ET:

If the Minnesota Vikings win, the market will resolve to “Vikings”.

If the San Francisco 49ers win, the market will resolve to “49ers”.

 If the game is not completed by October 30, 2023 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: NFL
events.description: This is a market group for NFL games happening on 2023-10-23

question: Will the Fed raise interest rates by 0 bps after its December meeting?
description:
The FED interest rates are defined in this market by the upper bound of the target federal funds range. The decisions on the target federal fund range are made by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meetings.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if following the Federal Reserve's December 2023 meeting the upper bound of the target federal funds rate is exactly the same as the level it was prior to the meeting (namely it increased 0 bps). Otherwise, it will resolve to “No.”

The resolution source for this market is the FOMC’s statement after its meeting scheduled for December 12 - 13, 2023 according to the official calendar: https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/fomccalendars.htm.

The level and change of the target federal funds rate is also published at the official website of the Federal Reserve at https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/openmarket.htm.

This market may resolve as soon as the FOMC’s statement for their December meeting with relevant data is issued. If no statement is released by December 20, 2023, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: Fed Interest Rates: December 2023
events.description: Market Group on December Fed interest rates.

question: Will the Fed raise interest rates by 25 bps after its December meeting?
description:
The FED interest rates are defined in this market by the upper bound of the target federal funds range. The decisions on the target federal fund range are made by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meetings.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if following the Federal Reserve's December 2023 meeting the upper bound of the target federal funds rate is increased exactly 25 basis points over the level it was prior to the meeting. Otherwise, it will resolve to “No.”

The resolution source for this market is the FOMC’s statement after its meeting scheduled for December 12 - 13, 2023 according to the official calendar: https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/fomccalendars.htm.

The level and change of the target federal funds rate is also published at the official website of the Federal Reserve at https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/openmarket.htm.

This market may resolve as soon as the FOMC’s statement for their December meeting with relevant data is issued. If no statement is released by December 20, 2023, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: Fed Interest Rates: December 2023
events.description: Market Group on December Fed interest rates.

question: Will Byron Donalds be the next Speaker?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Byron Donalds is elected to be the next US Speaker of the House after Kevin McCarthy's ousting on October 3, 2023. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purpose of resolving this market, unelected or temporary Speakers will not count toward a "Yes" resolution (e.g. Speaker Pro Tempore).

The primary resolution source for this market will be information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

If a new US Speaker of the House is not elected by June 30, 2024 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No."

events.title: Who will be the next speaker?

question: Will Mike Johnson be the next Speaker?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Mike Johnson is elected to be the next US Speaker of the House after Kevin McCarthy's ousting on October 3, 2023. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purpose of resolving this market, unelected or temporary Speakers will not count toward a "Yes" resolution (e.g. Speaker Pro Tempore).

The primary resolution source for this market will be information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

If a new US Speaker of the House is not elected by June 30, 2024 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No."

events.title: Who will be the next speaker?

question: Tyson Fury vs. Francis Ngannou
description:
This market will resolve to "Fury" if Tyson Fury is officially declared the winner of the boxing match against Francis Ngannou, currently scheduled for October 28, 2023 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. It will resolve to "Ngannou" if Ngannou is declared the winner. 

If this fight ends in a draw, is not officially designated as a win for either Tyson Fury or Francis Ngannou, is cancelled, or moved to a date after November 4, 2023, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: Tyson Fury vs. Francis Ngannou
events.description:
This market will resolve to "Fury" if Tyson Fury is officially declared the winner of the boxing match against Francis Ngannou, currently scheduled for October 28, 2023 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. It will resolve to "Ngannou" if Ngannou is declared the winner. 

If this fight ends in a draw, is not officially designated as a win for either Tyson Fury or Francis Ngannou, is cancelled, or moved to a date after November 4, 2023, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will BTC hit $40,000 by Halloween?
description:
This market will immediately resolve to “Yes” if any Coinbase 1 minute candle for BTC-USD between 22 Oct '23 17:00 and 31 Oct '23 23:59 in the ET timezone has a final “High” price of 40,000.00 or higher. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is https://www.coinbase.com/, specifically the BTC-USD "High" prices currently available at https://www.coinbase.com/advanced-trade/BTC-USD with “1m” and “Candles” selected on the top bar.

To see the "High" prices, mouse over particular candles and look at the value "H" at the top of the chart.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Coinbase BTC-USD, not according to other sources or spot markets.
